alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 04 at 4:06PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 615 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain continuing to fall over the slopes above the west side of the Big Island from Keahole Point to Captain Cook with rainfall rates up to 1 inch per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Honalo, Holualoa, Kahaluu-Keauhou, Kainaliu, Kealakekua, Honaunau, Kalaoa and Kona International Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 615 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
